concept.title: History of DITA
concept.shortdesc: Here you will find a short history of DITA and how it has affected the world of technical communication.

conbody.p: With the invention of the XML - or, eXtensible markup language - in the mid 1990's, IBM worked to develop a program through which XML could be processed for documentation. Thus, DITA was born in 2001 to simplify XML and allow it to be used as a language for documentation. The DITA maps were especially significant in that they organized and outlined content like never before.

The next addition to DITA was the Open Toolkit, which added domain specialization to the already created topic specialization through a set of XSLT stylesheets. IBM encouraged the integration of Open Toolkit to publish DITA, and many vendors have followed suit over the years.
